--- Customer (Infrastructure) ---

I have been informed from the partner team, that they have purchased/renewed the license for KiroConnect, now I want to know how to export and install the license key to extend my expiry date


--- AI Assistant ---

Thanks for clarifying! So you've received a new/renewed license from your partner, and you need help with installing it to extend your expiry date. Let me walk you through this process.


--- AI Assistant ---

Perfect! I found the information you need. There are actually two methods to install your renewed license key:

Method 1: Update Registration Info (Recommended)

This is the easiest method if your Kerio Connect server has a working Internet connection:

  1. Open the Kerio Connect Administration console
  2. Select Dashboard, and click on Update registration info
  3. Enter your license key code when prompted
  4. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the registration

Note: Your server needs unrestricted HTTPS traffic on port 443 for this method to work.

Method 2: Manually Install License Key File

If Method 1 doesn't work or you prefer a manual approach:

  1. Open the Kerio Product registration page
  2. Enter your license key and the captcha code, then click NEXT
  3. The next screen will display a summary of your license details - verify they're correct and click NEXT
  4. Download the license file
  5. Import this file into your Kerio Connect Administration console

For more detailed step-by-step instructions, you can check out these articles:

  • Kerio Connect Licensing Issues
  • Modifying or Extending a Kerio Connect License Key

Have you received the license key from your partner yet? If so, which method would you like to try first?
